snippet: A working group of an Internet standards body has decided that Web users should be able to decline custom-targeted advertising, but hurdles remain before a final agreement can be reached.
abstract: Working group of World Wide Web Consortium says Web users should be able to tell advertising networks not to show them targeted advertisements based on their browsing activities--and those companies should comply; hurdles remain before final agreement can be reached on Do Not Track standard.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and NATASHA SINGER

lead_paragraph: A working group of an Internet standards body has decided that Web users should be able to decline custom-targeted advertising, but hurdles remain before a final agreement can be reached.

headline.main: ‘Do Not Track’ Rules Come a Step Closer to an Agreement
headline.print_headline: ‘Do Not Track’ Rules for Advertising to Web Users Come a Step Closer to an Agreement
